FuncDef:
The ospf bfd block command prevents an interface from dynamically setting up a BFD session.
The undo ospf bfd block command cancels the configuration.
By default, BFD is enabled in the OSPF interface view.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the bfd all-interfaces enable command is run in an OSPF process, BFD sessions are created on all the OSPF interfaces whose neighbor status is Full. If BFD is not required on some interfaces, run the ospf bfd block command on the interfaces to prevent them from dynamically setting up BFD sessions.
Prerequisites
BFD has been enabled on interfaces.
Precautions
The ospf bfd enable command and ospf bfd block command are mutually exclusive in function, and the later configuration overwrites the previous one.
